page.title: 07Agriculture in Penshurst.
page.content: Mr.Fredrick works with his brothers. He owns 550 acres, 120 acres of it is barley, 150 acres of it is wheat, 80 acres of oats. They own 80-90 cattle and they also have sheep and a donkey. They have 5 tractors and 2 combine harvesters. The combine harvesters cost Â£30,000. This farm is typical of farms in the area. { Salmon's Farm Oast}is of particular interest because it has hop gardens. Once a hop garden has been put together it lasts 20 years. The hop gardens are strung from Feburary to April. Six men take about 4 weeks to string the hops. Hops are ready to be harvested at the end of August and early September. { Penshurst Vineyards}have 15 acres of grapes and 12 acres of apples. He makes 35,000 bottles of wine and apple juice sold locally.
